page.title: 19TRANSPORT EXECUTIVE
page.content: April 1974 saw the formation of the South Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive, from the former Rotherham , Sheffield and Doncaster municiple transport departments. Early in 1977 the executive decided that it would be necessary to expand the Rotherham fleet during the next ten years.The depot already in use at Rawmarsh, was then seventy years old, and the decision was taken to build a new depot alongside Midland Road in Masbrough. In total, the buildings cover 20,837 square metres, mainly in two blocks. One contains the main garage,workshops,offices and canteen, the other contains the support services. There is room inside the garage to park up to 200 buses.There are two cleaning areas, one where buses are washed every day, the other every week.
